description.narrative:
Sveriges ambassad har fått en ansökan från UNDP BIH om stöd med 39 MSEK för att genomföra projektet GED “Green Economic Programme - Fas 2" i Bosnien och Hercegovina (BIH) under perioden 2018-2020.
Syfte med projektet är att förbättra och öka energieffektiviteten i BiH som kan uppnås genom att genomföra sex sammankopplade och kompletterande komponenter: 1) Kapacitetsuppbyggnad och rättsliga ramar för energieffektivisering och förnybar energi. Utveckling och kapacitetsuppbyggnad av kommuner, miljöfonder och energipersonal inom energieffektiva offentliga belysningssystem, förnybara energikällor och utvecklingsfördelar av EE/RES projekt. 2) Institutionalisering av energihantering - kostnader, utsläppshantering och övervakning av växthusgaser i BiH kommuner (GED projektet täckte endast entiteternas och kantonnivåen). 3) Utveckling av finansiella mekanismer för grön ekonomisk finansiering i Bosnien och Hercegovina - Utveckling och antagande av hållbara finansiella mekanismer inom fonderna för miljöskydd inom energieffektivitet och förnybara energikällor som bygger, bidrar till och kontrollerar miljö och mänsklig utveckling. 4) Infrastrukturåtgärder i kommuner i Bosnien och Hercegovina - energieffektiva offentliga belysningssystem; solsystem i offentliga byggnader; energieffektivitet och förnybara energiåtgärder i offentliga byggnader 5) medvetenhet och marknadsföringskampanj till allmänheten - öka allmänhetens medvetande om utveckling som en följd av ren och förnybar energi och energieffektivitet. 6) Förnybara energilösningar för hushåll på landsbygden utanför elnätet - tillhandahålla lösningar för solceller och solsystem (el och värmeproduktion) till avlägsna områden (ej anslutna till elnätet) utan el i BiH.
Projektet är en fortsättning av GED (Green Economic Development) som genomförs av UNDP och finansieras av Sverige sedan år 2014 som kommer att avslutas i 2018. Projektet har uppnått bra resultat och många av målen har t.o.m. överstigit.
Total budget för projektet är 55 MSEK, varav miljöskyddsfonderna och UNDP ska bidra med cirka 15 MSEK och Sveriges ambassad ska finansiera med 39 MSEK under perioden 2018-2020. 1 MSEK ska sättas undan inom en separat komponent för uppföljning och utvärdering.

UNDP BIH has approached Embassy of Sweden/Sida for funding of 39 million SEK to carry out the “Green Economic Programme - Phase 2” in Bosna and Herzegovina during the period 2018-2020. The intervention aims at improving and scale up of energy efficiency in BIH which will be achieved by implementation of six interlinked and supplementary project components:: 1) Capacity Building & Legal Framework for EE/RES– Development and capacity building of municipal authorities, Environmental Funds and energy professionals on energy efficient public lighting systems and renewable energy sources and human development benefits of EE/RES projects. 2) Institutionalization of energy management– Systematic energy, costs and GHG emission management and monitoring in BiH municipalities (the GED project previously covered the entity and cantonal level only). 3) Development of financial mechanisms for green economic financing in BiH – Development and adoption of sustainable financial mechanisms within Environmental Protection Funds on energy efficiency and renewable energy sources which are based, contribute and capture/monitor environmental and human development. 4) Infrastructure measures in BiH municipalities - energy efficient public lighting systems; solar systems at public sector buildings; infrastructural energy efficiency and renewable energy measures in public sector buildings 5) Public awareness / marketing campaign– increasing public awareness on human development as a result of clean/renewable energy and on energy efficiency. 6) Renewable energy solution for households living in rural areas off the power grid – provide hybrid phot
The intervention presents logical continuation to the ongoing Green Economic Development (GED) Project, implemented by UNDP and financed by Sweden since 2014, which is coming to its end after 2018. but which has achieved many good results and exceeded a lot of targets.
The intervention’s total budget is 55 million SEK, out of which two environmental funds and UNDP are contributing with approximately 30 million SEK and 39MSEK is Swedens contribution for the period 2018-2020. Additionally, 1 MSEK will be reserved within separate component for monitoring and evaluation purposes.

The main goal of Green Economic Development phase II project is to further contribute to scale up of energy efficiency in BIH and the creation of a favourable environment for investing in EE and RES measures in BiH.

description.narrative: Project continues with a good progress on all components. Overview of achievements in 2019 and related challenges is presented below: The project is continuing with scaling-up and creation self-sustainability within EE/RES related activities in BiH and contribution to BiHs EU accession and fulfilment of Energy Community Treaty obligations. Rulebook on Energy Efficiency Information System for FBiH (ISEE, http://www.iseefbih.ba/) has been adopted in January 2019, and Decision on the establishment of energy management system and information system of energy efficiency in institutions at the state level BiH and mandatory data entry and regular reporting has been adopted by Council of Ministers of BIH in June 2019, which positioned EMIS for the first time as obligatory software for monitoring and reporting regarding energy consumption in public sector in BiH. The Rulebook for Republika Srpska is prepared, but not adopted yet. The organizational scheme for energy management system at the state level of BiH is developed, and it implies appointment of one energy manager-coordinator and one energy manager in Ministry of Foreign Trade and Economic Relations of BiH and one energy manager in the Service for Common Affairs of the Institutions of BiH, which are going to be the carriers of activities in establishment of energy management system. Mentioned energy managers were employed through the Project for the period of 18 months, while after this period they will be employed by mentioned institutions. These activities, together with installation of energy monitoring equipment for each building used by state government institutions of BiH, will ensure a self-sustainability. The Energy Intensity Mapping application has been developed as a new module within the EMIS. The tool provides an easy visualization of the energy intensity in buildings through a virtual and interactive map with a user-friendly interface. It is a unique database that combines energy consumption (kWh) and building characteristics (m2 of heated area, building type, number of beneficiaries). The map enables a comparison of energy or water consumption, as well as CO2 emissions over time for any given building, or group of buildings, which also facilitates the tracking of savings for buildings that have been retrofitted. The tool is also equipped with the spreadsheets which can be exported for analytical or other purposes. Infrastructure works were performed on 47 public buildings. Solar systems have been installed on 10 buildings, and 6 public lighting systems have been modernized with new, energy-efficient LED luminaires. By implementing energy efficiency infrastructural works and taking into account prices and real energy needs baseline, most of the buildings will achieve about 50% of cost savings, and total amount of CO2 emission reduction is 2,624 t. Number of direct beneficiaries of energy efficiency/renewable energy sources infrastructural works is 452,084, out of which 207,958 women. Since the total investment for conducted works in 2019 is 10,598,955.77 BAM, the total number of generated green jobs is 518. Swedish funds helped to unlock available funds for energy efficiency measures from end users (owners of public institutions), and total ratio of co-financing is 70% by local institutions and 30% grant. Owners of buildings committed to re-invest energy savings into further retrofitting of their buildings or other infrastructure. The installation of solar systems for the off grid households without access to electricity was implemented for 16 households with a total of 52 users, of which 55.7% were men and 44.3% women. Air quality measuring equipment, which by its characteristics belongs to the group of the most modern devices currently available in the world when it comes to measuring air pollution parameters, was purchased for the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering in Sarajevo, and it will significantly contribute to the research projects related to improvement of the air quality in Sarajevo Canton. Synergies have been continuously established with other internationally financed EEproject, primarily with World bank financed project, GIZ and USAID. The UNDP is a key partner of the Programme holding entire responsibility for theimplementation, whilst two entities environmental funds and number of cantonal andmunicipal authorities are important programme partners and co-financiers of theprogramme. Cooperation with UNDP was very good and productive duringthe implementation period. Progress was discussed bi-annually at regular project board meetings, among representatives of UNDP, both environmental funds, MOFTER and the Embassy. Results were regularly reported through annual reports, but also regularly through daily communication or based on ad-hock requests. All deliveries were timely and of sufficient quality. Finally, the project has been effective during reporting period, achieving many positive results under each component
